verses.text_plain: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
verses.verse_html: 1Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

verses.text_plain: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
verses.verse_html:
2Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth. ▼
▼ in my mouth: Heb. in my palate

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in my mouth: Heb. in my palate
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in my mouth: Heb. in my palate

verses.text_plain: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
verses.verse_html: 3My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

verses.text_plain: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
verses.verse_html: 4The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

verses.text_plain: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
verses.verse_html: 5If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

verses.text_plain: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
verses.verse_html:
6Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay. ▼
▼ wish: Heb. mouth
 , ▼
▼ formed: Heb. cut

verses.text_plain: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
verses.verse_html: 7Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

verses.text_plain: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
verses.verse_html:
8Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying, ▼
▼ hearing: Heb. ears

verses.text_plain: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
verses.verse_html: 9I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

verses.text_plain: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
verses.verse_html: 10Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

verses.text_plain: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
verses.verse_html: 11He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

verses.text_plain: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
verses.verse_html: 12Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

verses.text_plain: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
verses.verse_html:
13Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters. ▼
▼ he giveth…: Heb. he answereth not

tokens.text: against him? for he giveth not account

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he giveth…: Heb. he answereth not
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he giveth…: Heb. he answereth not

verses.text_plain: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
verses.verse_html: 14For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

verses.text_plain: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
verses.verse_html: 15In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

verses.text_plain: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
verses.verse_html:
16Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction, ▼
▼ he…: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth

footnotes.body_text: ▼ he…: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth
footnotes.body_html: ▼ he…: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth

verses.text_plain: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
verses.verse_html:
17That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man. ▼
▼ purpose: Heb. work

verses.text_plain: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.verse_html:
18He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword. ▼
▼ from perishing: Heb. from passing

footnotes.body_html: ▼ from perishing: Heb. from passing

verses.text_plain: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
verses.verse_html: 19He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

verses.text_plain: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
verses.verse_html:
20So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat. ▼
▼ dainty…: Heb. meat of desire

footnotes.body_html: ▼ dainty…: Heb. meat of desire

verses.text_plain: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.verse_html: 21His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

verses.text_plain: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
verses.verse_html: 22Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

verses.text_plain: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
verses.verse_html: 23If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

verses.text_plain: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
verses.verse_html:
24Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom. ▼
▼ a ransom: or, an atonement

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a ransom: or, an atonement

verses.text_plain: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:
verses.verse_html:
25His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth: ▼
▼ a child’s: Heb. childhood

footnotes.body_html: ▼ a child’s: Heb. childhood

verses.text_plain: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
verses.verse_html: 26He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

tokens.text: unto him: and he shall see

verses.text_plain: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
verses.verse_html:
27He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not; ▼
▼ He…: or, He shall look upon men, and say

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He…: or, He shall look upon men, and say
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He…: or, He shall look upon men, and say

verses.text_plain: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
verses.verse_html:
28He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light. ▼
▼ He…: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life

footnotes.body_text: ▼ He…: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life
footnotes.body_html: ▼ He…: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life

verses.text_plain: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
verses.verse_html:
29Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man, ▼
▼ oftentimes: Heb. twice and thrice

footnotes.body_html: ▼ oftentimes: Heb. twice and thrice

verses.text_plain: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
verses.verse_html: 30To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

verses.text_plain: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
verses.verse_html: 31Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

verses.text_plain: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
verses.verse_html: 32If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

verses.text_plain: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
verses.verse_html: 33If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
